materials.raw_text: B: 15 g, Be: 9 g, Ru: 30 g, Tb: 12 g

sourcing.instructions: B: Chemical supply store; Be: Specialty metal supplier; Ru: Precious metals dealer; Tb: Rare earth elements supplier
steps: B: Chemical supply store; Be: Specialty metal supplier; Ru: Precious metals dealer; Tb: Rare earth elements supplier

1. Measure out 15 g of boron (B). 2. Measure 9 g of beryllium (Be). 3. Measure 30 g of ruthenium (Ru). 4. Measure 12 g of terbium (Tb). 5. In a clean, dry container, combine all measured components thoroughly using a spatula. Ensure uniform distribution without clumps.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure out 15 g of boron (B). 2. Measure 9 g of beryllium (Be). 3. Measure 30 g of ruthenium (Ru). 4. Measure 12 g of terbium (Tb). 5. In a clean, dry container, combine all measured components thoroughly using a spatula. Ensure uniform distribution without clumps.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixture to a graphite crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat to 1200°C (2192°F) at a rate of 10°C/min. 4. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and homogenization.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixture to a graphite crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat to 1200°C (2192°F) at a rate of 10°C/min. 4. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and homogenization.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool naturally to 600°C (1112°F) over approximately 1 hour. 2. Once at 600°C, remove the crucible and place it in an insulated container to ensure slower cooling to room temperature. This should take about 6 hours.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool naturally to 600°C (1112°F) over approximately 1 hour. 2. Once at 600°C, remove the crucible and place it in an insulated container to ensure slower cooling to room temperature. This should take about 6 hours.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond file to smooth out any rough edges. 3. Optionally, coat the surface with a clear sealant to protect from oxidation. Allow the sealant to dry completely as per manufacturer instructions.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond file to smooth out any rough edges. 3. Optionally, coat the surface with a clear sealant to protect from oxidation. Allow the sealant to dry completely as per manufacturer instructions.
